parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Order the given unit(s) to follow the given other unit or vehicle eg (without radio messages). Also is used to resume unit formation after [[doStop]], just [[doFollow]] leader even if it is the leader himself you want to resume (see Example 2).

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unitName '''doFollow''' unitName2

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]] or [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> unitName2: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldier1 [[doFollow]] _soldier2</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[units]] _group [[doFollow]] [[leader]] _group;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[commandFollow]], [[formationLeader]], [[formLeader]], [[isFormationLeader]], [[leader]], [[selectLeader]], [[setLeader]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">Unknown <dd class="note">These commands ([[doFollow]] or [[commandFollow]]) work only if the two units are in the same group.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>



[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.99|DOFOLLOW]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.96|DOFOLLOW]]
[[Category:Scripting Commands OFP 1.46|DOFOLLOW]]

<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 29, 2016 - 22:48 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:BaerMitUmlaut|BaerMitUmlaut]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The name of this command is a bit misleading, it is used to make a unit return to the formation of its group or subformation.
</dd>
</dl>
